As a currently high plat/low diamond player that has played about 50 games in low plat this season alone I can assure you that there's no "cookie cutter" shit because its just how the game is, and I will expand:

ADC:
Every adc has a few core items and then a few situational, this exists in plat aswell.

Support:
Every support has a few core items and then a few situational tank ones, this exists in plat aswell.

Mid: 
Every mid champ has a few core items and then lane situational and game situational ones, this exists in plat aswell (zhonyas/void staff/qss/a possible tank item etc.).

Jungle:
Jungler item, and then maybe somewhat cookie cutter when it comes to junglers, simply because with the current meta junglers they have very specific core builds they go nearly every game, but still some situational in there.

Top:
Every top has a few core items and from there its usually situational. 

I dont know if this shows why plat isnt all "cookie cutter" builds to you but I strongly disagree with that statement and have never in my games in low/mid range plat elo seen someone that builds the same build every game except for myself on warwick because I love my build and its almost always good, just the order changes (frozen heart vs. gauntlet for example, or maybe a spirit or randuins), but thats a thing on ww for diamond elo aswell if you take a look at warwick one tricks they have a build line they usually follow. Junglers are also an exception imo because having 1 item that you pretty much always buy the same of (jungler item) already makes it harder to change the build around.

Hope this makes sense.

{{item:1029}} or{{item:1054}} ?
Cloth, new Doran's shield doesn't block 8 damage and the "20 seconds of HP regen" isn't that great when panth chucks a spear every 6 seconds. Unless he's got longsword 3, go cloth.

doran's shield is absolutely amazing against pantheon

assuming that pantheon actually spams spear off cooldown (which means you are mysteriously standing in his range constantly for no reason), then dshield's passive will recover 12 health between casts, more than the 8 blocked by old dshield.

Dorans Shield is a pretty good start vs Pantheon.
I really don't mind Pantheon at all, but it might be due to my champion choice.
His Q takes up a high amount of mana. I play champions who have a high amount of sustain, and I just farm while healing up from poke. He'll be oom by the time I'm half health, and have a small cs lead too, since he's so focused on harassing me. 
He'll be popping corrupters at full health just for the mana, losing out on the item's efficiency. 

My way of dealing with him is to completely ignore Pantheon's existence. Cannon minion low on health and Pantheon trying to zone you off? Ignore him and go for that cannon minion. If you get low on health, recall and buy some more sustain/tank items. Do not stay in lane and try to fight him. Keep repeating and you'll soon be too tanky for him to kill. Eventually, Pantheon's psyche will be so scarred by his inadequacy to kill you, and your neglect of his presence, that he won't even try anymore. Outscale him hard, render him useless and make him wonder what he's doing with his life when he stares at the post game lobby in reflection.

Note that this mainly works for me because my champions have innate healing. This may not work for your certain champs.
